clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Handover to a Post Anaesthesia Care Unit in a Children's Hospital

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Ministry of Work, Health and Social Affairs in North Rhine-Westph

brief_summary.textblock:
Postoperative handovers to the post anaesthesia care unit (PACU) in adult anaesthesia are described as incomplete and unstructured, although their relevance for the patient safety is well known. It must be assumed that for children, this handover is at least comparable important.
With a self-developed checklist information transfer during postoperative handovers will be documented and subsequently compared with patient information in anaesthesia records.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Quantity of Information Loss during Postoperative Handovers in the PACU

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of patients (<18 years of age) at Children's Hospital Cologne, being admitted to the main postoperative care unit (PACU), after they underwent interventions within normal surgery hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients transferred to the PACU after surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age > 18 years
